00075 #include <limits.h>

00087 struct cache_t * cache_create_llc(
00088     struct core_t * const core,
00089     const char * const name,
00090     const bool read_only,
00091     const int sets,
00092     const int assoc,
00093     const int linesize,
00094     const char rp, /* replacement policy */
00095     const char ap, /* allocation policy */
00096     const char wp, /* write policy */
00097     const char wc, /* write combining */
00098     const int banks,
00099     const int bank_width, /* in bytes; i.e., the interleaving granularity */
00100     const int latency, /* in cycles */
00101     const int WBB_size, /* writeback-buffer size, in cache lines (for evictions) */
00102     const int MSHR_size, /* MSHR size (per bank), in requests */
00103     const int MSHR_banks, /* number of MSHR banks */
00104     const int begin_index,/* In case a shared cache what chunk lies with this cache*/
00105     const int end_index,
00106     struct cache_t * const next_level_cache, /* e.g., for the DL1, this should point to the L2 */
00107     struct bus_t * const next_bus /* e.g., for the DL1, this should point to the bus between DL1 and L2 */
00108     )
00109 {
00110   int i;
00111   struct cache_t * cp = (struct cache_t*) calloc(1,sizeof(*cp));
00112   if(!cp)
00113     fatal("failed to calloc cache %s",name);
00114 
00115   enum repl_policy_t replacement_policy;
00116   enum alloc_policy_t allocate_policy;
00117   enum write_policy_t write_policy;
00118   int write_combining;
00119 
00120   cp->core = core;
00121 
00122   switch(mytoupper(rp)) {
00123     case 'L': replacement_policy = REPLACE_LRU; break;
00124     case 'M': replacement_policy = REPLACE_MRU; break;
00125     case 'R': replacement_policy = REPLACE_RANDOM; break;
00126     case 'N': replacement_policy = REPLACE_NMRU; break;
00127     case 'P': replacement_policy = REPLACE_PLRU; break;
00128     case 'C': replacement_policy = REPLACE_CLOCK; break;
00129     default: fatal("unrecognized cache replacement policy");
00130   }
00131   switch(mytoupper(ap)) {
00132     case 'W': allocate_policy = WRITE_ALLOC; break;
00133     case 'N': allocate_policy = NO_WRITE_ALLOC; break;
00134     default: fatal("unrecognized cache allocation policy (W=write-alloc,N=no-write-alloc)");
00135   }
00136   switch(mytoupper(wp)) {
00137     case 'T': write_policy = WRITE_THROUGH; break;
00138     case 'B': write_policy = WRITE_BACK; break;
00139     default: fatal("unrecognized cache write policy (T=write-Through,B=write-Back)");
00140   }
00141   switch(mytoupper(wc)) {
00142     case 'C': write_combining = true; break;
00143     case 'N': write_combining = false; break;
00144     default: fatal("unrecognized cache write combining option (C=write-Combining,N=No-write-combining)");
00145   }
00146 
00147   cp->name = strdup(name);
00148   if(!cp->name)
00149     fatal("failed to strdup %s's name",name);
00150   cp->read_only = (enum read_only_t) read_only;
00151   cp->sets = sets;
00152   cp->assoc = assoc;
00153   cp->log2_assoc = (int)(ceil(log(assoc)/log(2.0)));
00154   cp->linesize = linesize;
00155   cp->replacement_policy = replacement_policy;
00156   cp->allocate_policy = allocate_policy;
00157   cp->write_policy = write_policy;
00158   cp->banks = banks;
00159   cp->bank_width = bank_width;
00160   cp->bank_mask = banks-1;
00161   cp->latency = latency;
00162   cp->write_combining = write_combining;
00163   cp->WBB_size = WBB_size;
00164   cp->MSHR_size = MSHR_size;
00165   cp->MSHR_banks = MSHR_banks;
00166   cp->MSHR_mask = MSHR_banks-1;
00167   cp->next_level = next_level_cache;
00168   cp->next_bus = next_bus;
00169   cp->check_for_work = true;
00170   cp->check_for_MSHR_fill_work = true;
00171 
00172   if((cp->replacement_policy == REPLACE_PLRU) && (assoc & (assoc-1)))
00173     fatal("Tree-based PLRU only works when associativity is a power of two");
00174   if((cp->replacement_policy == REPLACE_CLOCK) && (assoc > 64))
00175     fatal("Clock-based PLRU only works when associativity is <= 64");
00176 
00177   /* bits to shift to get to the tag */
00178   cp->addr_shift = (int)ceil(log(linesize)/log(2.0));
00179   /* bits to shift to get the bank number */
00180   cp->bank_shift = (int)ceil(log(linesize)/log(2.0));
00181 
00182   if((sets & (sets-1)) != 0)
00183     fatal("%s cache sets must be power of two");
00184   if((linesize & (linesize-1)) != 0)
00185     fatal("%s linesize must be power of two");
00186   if((banks & (banks-1)) != 0)
00187     fatal("%s banks must be power of two");
00188 
00189   cp->blocks = (struct cache_line_t**) calloc(sets,sizeof(*cp->blocks));
00190   if(!cp->blocks)
00191     fatal("failed to calloc cp->blocks");
00192   for(i=0;i<sets;i++)
00193   {
00194     /* allocate as one big block! */
00195     struct cache_line_t * line = (struct cache_line_t*) calloc(assoc,sizeof(*line));
00196     memset(line,0,assoc*sizeof(*line)); // for some weird reason valgrind was reporting that "line" was being used uninitialized, despite being calloc'd above?
00197     if(!line)
00198       fatal("failed to calloc cache line for %s",name);
00199 
00200     for(int j=0;j<assoc;j++)
00201     {
00202       line[j].way = j;
00203       line[j].next = &line[j+1];
00204     }
00205     line[assoc-1].next = NULL;
00206     cp->blocks[i] = line;
00207   }
00208 
00209   cp->heap_size = 1 << ((int) rint(ceil(log(latency+1)/log(2.0))));
00210 
00211   cp->pipe = (struct cache_action_t**) calloc(banks,sizeof(*cp->pipe));
00212   cp->pipe_num = (int*) calloc(banks,sizeof(*cp->pipe_num));
00213   cp->fill_pipe = (struct cache_fill_t**) calloc(banks,sizeof(*cp->fill_pipe));
00214   cp->fill_num = (int*) calloc(banks,sizeof(*cp->fill_num));
00215   if(!cp->pipe || !cp->fill_pipe || !cp->pipe_num || !cp->fill_num)
00216     fatal("failed to calloc cp->pipe for %s",name);
00217   for(i=0;i<banks;i++)
00218   {
00219     cp->pipe[i] = (struct cache_action_t*) calloc(cp->heap_size,sizeof(**cp->pipe));
00220     if(!cp->pipe[i])
00221       fatal("failed to calloc cp->pipe[%d] for %s",i,name);
00222     cp->fill_pipe[i] = (struct cache_fill_t*) calloc(cp->heap_size,sizeof(**cp->fill_pipe));
00223     if(!cp->fill_pipe[i])
00224       fatal("failed to calloc cp->fill_pipe[%d] for %s",i,name);
00225   }
00226 
00227   cp->MSHR = (struct cache_action_t**) calloc(MSHR_banks,sizeof(*cp->MSHR));
00228   if(!cp->MSHR)
00229     fatal("failed to calloc cp->MSHR for %s",name);
00230   for(i=0;i<MSHR_banks;i++)
00231   {
00232     cp->MSHR[i] = (struct cache_action_t*) calloc(MSHR_size,sizeof(**cp->MSHR));
00233     if(!cp->MSHR[i])
00234       fatal("failed to calloc cp->MSHR[%d] for %s",i,name);
00235   }
00236 
00237   cp->MSHR_num = (int*) calloc(MSHR_banks,sizeof(*cp->MSHR_num));
00238   if(!cp->MSHR_num)
00239     fatal("failed to calloc cp->MSHR_num");
00240   cp->MSHR_num_pf = (int*) calloc(MSHR_banks,sizeof(*cp->MSHR_num_pf));
00241   if(!cp->MSHR_num_pf)
00242     fatal("failed to calloc cp->MSHR_num_pf");
00243   cp->MSHR_fill_num = (int*) calloc(MSHR_banks,sizeof(*cp->MSHR_fill_num));
00244   if(!cp->MSHR_fill_num)
00245     fatal("failed to calloc cp->MSHR_fill_num");
00246   cp->MSHR_unprocessed_num = (int*) calloc(MSHR_banks,sizeof(*cp->MSHR_unprocessed_num));
00247   if(!cp->MSHR_unprocessed_num)
00248     fatal("failed to calloc cp->MSHR_unprocessed_num");
00249 
00250   cp->WBB_num = (int*) calloc(MSHR_banks,sizeof(*cp->WBB_num));
00251   if(!cp->WBB_num)
00252     fatal("failed to calloc cp->WBB_num");
00253   cp->WBB_head = (int*) calloc(MSHR_banks,sizeof(*cp->WBB_head));
00254   if(!cp->WBB_head)
00255     fatal("failed to calloc cp->WBB_head");
00256   cp->WBB_tail = (int*) calloc(MSHR_banks,sizeof(*cp->WBB_tail));
00257   if(!cp->WBB_tail)
00258     fatal("failed to calloc cp->WBB_tail");
00259 
00260   cp->WBB = (struct cache_line_t**) calloc(MSHR_banks,sizeof(*cp->WBB));
00261   if(!cp->WBB)
00262     fatal("failed to calloc cp->WBB");
00263   for(i=0;i<MSHR_banks;i++)
00264   {
00265     cp->WBB[i] = (struct cache_line_t*) calloc(WBB_size,sizeof(**cp->WBB));
00266     if(!cp->WBB[i])
00267       fatal("failed to calloc cp->WBB[%d] for %s",i,name);
00268   }
00269 
00270   if(!strcasecmp(name,"LLC"))
00271   {
00272     cp->stat.core_lookups = (counter_t*) calloc(num_threads,sizeof(*cp->stat.core_lookups));
00273     cp->stat.core_misses = (counter_t*) calloc(num_threads,sizeof(*cp->stat.core_misses));
00274     if(!cp->stat.core_lookups || !cp->stat.core_misses)
00275       fatal("failed to calloc cp->stat.core_{lookups|misses} for %s",name);
00276   }
00277 
00278   return cp;
00279 }
00280 
00281 void LLC_reg_stats(
00282     struct stat_sdb_t * const sdb,
00283     struct cache_t * const cp)
00284 {
00285   char buf[256];
00286   char buf2[256];
00287   char buf3[256];
00288 
00289   assert(cp->read_only == CACHE_READWRITE);
00290 
00291   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.load_lookups",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00292   sprintf(buf2,"number of load lookups in LLC");
00293   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.load_lookups, 0, NULL);
00294   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.load_misses",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00295   sprintf(buf2,"number of load misses in LLC");
00296   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.load_misses, 0, NULL);
00297   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.load_miss_rate",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00298   sprintf(buf2,"load miss rate in LLC");
00299   sprintf(buf3,"u%d.LLC.load_misses/u%d.LLC.load_lookups",cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->node_ip);
00300   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.4f");
00301 
00302   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.store_lookups",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00303   sprintf(buf2,"number of store lookups in LLC");
00304   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.store_lookups, 0, NULL);
00305   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.store_misses",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00306   sprintf(buf2,"number of store misses in LLC");
00307   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.store_misses, 0, NULL);
00308   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.store_miss_rate",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00309   sprintf(buf2,"store miss rate in LLC");
00310   sprintf(buf3,"u%d.LLC.store_misses/u%d.LLC.store_lookups",cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->node_ip);
00311   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.4f");
00312 
00313   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.writeback_lookups",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00314   sprintf(buf2,"number of writeback lookups in LLC");
00315   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.writeback_lookups, 0, NULL);
00316   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.writeback_misses",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00317   sprintf(buf2,"number of writeback misses in LLC");
00318   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.writeback_misses, 0, NULL);
00319   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.writeback_miss_rate",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00320   sprintf(buf2,"writeback miss rate in LLC");
00321   sprintf(buf3,"u%d.LLC.writeback_misses/u%d.LLC.writeback_lookups",cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->node_ip);
00322   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.4f");
00323 
00324   if(cp->num_prefetchers > 0)
00325   {
00326     sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.pf_lookups",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00327     sprintf(buf2,"number of prefetch lookups in LLC");
00328     stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.prefetch_lookups, 0, NULL);
00329     sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.pf_misses",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00330     sprintf(buf2,"number of prefetch misses in LLC");
00331     stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.prefetch_misses, 0, NULL);
00332     sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.pf_miss_rate",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00333     sprintf(buf2,"prefetch miss rate in LLC");
00334     sprintf(buf3,"u%d.LLC.pf_misses/u%d.LLC.pf_lookups",cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->node_ip);
00335     stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.4f");
00336 
00337     sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.pf_insertions",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00338     sprintf(buf2,"number of prefetched blocks inserted into LLC");
00339     stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.prefetch_insertions, 0, NULL);
00340     sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.pf_useful_insertions",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00341     sprintf(buf2,"number of prefetched blocks actually used in LLC");
00342     stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.prefetch_useful_insertions, 0, NULL);
00343     sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.pf_useful_rate",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00344     sprintf(buf2,"rate of useful prefetches in LLC");
00345     sprintf(buf3,"u%d.LLC.pf_useful_insertions/u%d.LLC.pf_insertions",cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->node_ip);
00346     stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.4f");
00347     sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.total_lookups",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00348     sprintf(buf2,"total number of lookups in LLC (excluding writebacks)");
00349     sprintf(buf3,"u%d.LLC.load_lookups + u%d.LLC.store_lookups + u%d.LLC.pf_lookups",cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->node_ip);
00350     stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.0f");
00351     sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.total_misses",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00352     sprintf(buf2,"total number of misses in LLC (excluding writebacks)");
00353     sprintf(buf3,"u%d.LLC.load_misses + u%d.LLC.store_misses + u%d.LLC.pf_misses",cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->node_ip);
00354     stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.0f");
00355   }
00356   else
00357   {
00358     sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.total_lookups",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00359     sprintf(buf2,"total number of lookups in LLC (excluding writebacks)");
00360     sprintf(buf3,"u%d.LLC.load_lookups + u%d.LLC.store_lookups",cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->node_ip);
00361     stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.0f");
00362     sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.total_misses",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00363     sprintf(buf2,"total number of misses in LLC (excluding writebacks)");
00364     sprintf(buf3,"u%d.LLC.load_misses + u%d.LLC.store_misses",cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->node_ip);
00365     stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.0f");
00366   }
00367 
00368   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.total_miss_rate",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00369   sprintf(buf2,"total miss rate in LLC (excluding writebacks)");
00370   sprintf(buf3,"u%d.LLC.total_misses / u%d.LLC.total_lookups",cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->node_ip);
00371   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.4f");
00372 
00373   if(num_threads > 1)
00374   {
00375     sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.MPKC",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00376     sprintf(buf2,"MPKC for the LLC (no prefetches or writebacks)");
00377     sprintf(buf3,"((u%d.LLC.load_misses+u%d.LLC.store_misses) / sim_cycle) * 1000.0",cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->node_ip);
00378     stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.4f");
00379     sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.total_MPKC",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00380     sprintf(buf2,"MPKC for the LLC (including prefetches)");
00381     sprintf(buf3,"((u%d.LLC.load_misses+u%d.LLC.store_misses+u%d.LLC.pf_misses) / sim_cycle) * 1000.0",cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->node_ip);
00382     stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.4f");
00383   }
00384 
00385   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.WBB_write_insertions",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00386   sprintf(buf2,"total number of write/writeback insertions in LLC");
00387   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.WBB_insertions, 0, NULL);
00388   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.WBB_victim_insertions",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00389   sprintf(buf2,"total number of non-dirty WBB insertions in LLC");
00390   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.WBB_victim_insertions, 0, NULL);
00391   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.WBB_hits",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00392   sprintf(buf2,"total number hits in %s's WBB",cp->name);
00393   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.WBB_hits, 0, NULL);
00394   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.WBB_write_hits",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00395   sprintf(buf2,"total write/writeback hits in %s's WBB (write-combining)",cp->name);
00396   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.WBB_combines, 0, NULL);
00397   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.WBB_victim_hits",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00398   sprintf(buf2,"total number victim hits in %s's WBB",cp->name);
00399   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.WBB_victim_hits, 0, NULL);
00400   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.WBB_total_occupancy",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00401   sprintf(buf2,"cumulative WBB occupancy in %s (dirty-lines only)",cp->name);
00402   stat_reg_counter(sdb, false, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.WBB_occupancy, 0, NULL);
00403   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.WBB_avg_occupancy",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00404   sprintf(buf2,"average WBB entries in use in %s (dirty-lines only)",cp->name);
00405   sprintf(buf3,"(u%d.LLC.WBB_total_occupancy / sim_cycle)",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00406   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.4f");
00407   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.WBB_full_cycles",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00408   sprintf(buf2,"cycles WBB was full in %s (dirty-lines only)",cp->name);
00409   stat_reg_counter(sdb, false, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.WBB_full_cycles, 0, NULL);
00410   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.WBB_frac_full",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00411   sprintf(buf2,"fraction of time WBBs are full in %s (dirty-lines only)",cp->name);
00412   sprintf(buf3,"(u%d.LLC.WBB_full_cycles / sim_cycle)",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00413   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.4f");
00414 
00415   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.MSHR_total_occupancy",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00416   sprintf(buf2,"cumulative MSHR occupancy in LLC");
00417   stat_reg_counter(sdb, false, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.MSHR_occupancy, 0, NULL);
00418   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.MSHR_avg_occupancy",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00419   sprintf(buf2,"average MSHR entries in use in LLC");
00420   sprintf(buf3,"(u%d.LLC.MSHR_total_occupancy / sim_cycle)",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00421   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.4f");
00422   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.MSHR_full_cycles",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00423   sprintf(buf2,"cycles MSHR was full in LLC");
00424   stat_reg_counter(sdb, false, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.MSHR_full_cycles, 0, NULL);
00425   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.MSHR_full",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00426   sprintf(buf2,"fraction of time MSHRs are full in LLC");
00427   sprintf(buf3,"(u%d.LLC.MSHR_full_cycles / sim_cycle)",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00428   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.4f");
00429   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.MSHR_combos",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00430   sprintf(buf2,"MSHR requests combined in LLC");
00431   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.MSHR_combos, 0, NULL);
00432 
00433   if(num_threads == 1)
00434   {
00435     sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.lookups",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00436     sprintf(buf2,"number of lookups in the LLC");
00437     stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.core_lookups[0], 0, NULL);
00438     sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.misses",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00439     sprintf(buf2,"number of misses in the LLC");
00440     stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.core_misses[0], 0, NULL);
00441     sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.MPKI",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00442     sprintf(buf2,"MPKI for the LLC");
00443     sprintf(buf3,"(u%d.LLC.misses / c0.commit_insn) * 1000.0",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00444     stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.4f");
00445     sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.MPKC",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00446     sprintf(buf2,"MPKC for the LLC");
00447     sprintf(buf3,"(u%d.LLC.misses / c0.sim_cycle) * 1000.0",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00448     stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.4f");
00449   }
00450   else
00451   {
00452     /*TODO In case of private caches we register stats only for the cores in that tile, In Shared caches this has to be for all cores*/
00453     for(int i=0;i<cp->uncore->num_cores;i++)
00454     {
00455       sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.c%d.lookups",cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->core[i]->id);
00456       sprintf(buf2,"number of lookups by core %d in shared %s cache",cp->uncore->core[i]->id,cp->name);
00457       stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.core_lookups[cp->uncore->core[i]->id], 0, NULL);
00458       sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.c%d.misses",cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->core[i]->id);
00459       sprintf(buf2,"number of misses by core %d in shared %s cache",cp->uncore->core[i]->id,cp->name);
00460       stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.core_misses[cp->uncore->core[i]->id], 0, NULL);
00461       sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.c%d.miss_rate",cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->core[i]->id);
00462       sprintf(buf2,"miss rate by core %d in shared %s cache",cp->uncore->core[i]->id,cp->name);
00463       sprintf(buf3,"u%d.LLC.c%d.misses / u%d.LLC.c%d.lookups", cp->uncore->node_ip, cp->uncore->core[i]->id,   cp->uncore->node_ip ,   cp->uncore->core[i]->id);
00464       stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.4f");
00465       sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.c%d.MPKI",cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->core[i]->id);
00466       sprintf(buf2,"MPKI by core %d in shared %s cache",cp->uncore->core[i]->id,cp->name);
00467       sprintf(buf3,"(u%d.LLC.c%d.misses / c%d.commit_insn) * 1000.0",   cp->uncore->node_ip  ,cp->uncore->core[i]->id,cp->uncore->core[i]->id);
00468       stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.4f");
00469       sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.c%d.MPKC",cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->core[i]->id);
00470       sprintf(buf2,"MPKC by core %d in shared %s cache",cp->uncore->core[i]->id,cp->name);
00471       sprintf(buf3,"(u%d.LLC.c%d.misses / c%d.sim_cycle) * 1000.0",   cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->core[i]->id,cp->uncore->core[i]->id);
00472       stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.4f");
00473     }
00474   }
00475 
00476   if(cp->prefetcher)
00477     for(int i=0;i<cp->num_prefetchers;i++)
00478       cp->prefetcher[i]->reg_stats(sdb,NULL);
00479 }
00480 
00481 
00482 /* Returns true if the prefetch should get inserted into the cache */
00483 static int prefetch_filter_lookup(
00484     struct prefetch_filter_t * const p,
00485     const md_paddr_t addr)
00486 {
00487   if(sim_cycle >= (p->last_reset + p->reset_interval))
00488   {
00489     for(int i=0;i<p->num_entries;i++)
00490       p->table[i] = 3;
00491     p->last_reset = sim_cycle - (sim_cycle % p->reset_interval);
00492     return true;
00493   }
00494 
00495   int index = addr & p->mask;
00496   return (p->table[index] >= 2);
00497 }
00498 
00499 /* Update the filter's predictor based on whether a prefetch was useful or not. */
00500 static void prefetch_filter_update(
00501     struct prefetch_filter_t * const p,
00502     const md_paddr_t addr,
00503     const int useful)
00504 {
00505   const int index = addr & p->mask;
00506   if(sim_cycle > (p->last_reset + p->reset_interval))
00507   {
00508     for(int i=0;i<p->num_entries;i++)
00509       p->table[i] = 3;
00510     p->last_reset = sim_cycle - (sim_cycle % p->reset_interval);
00511   }
00512   if(useful)
00513   {
00514     if(p->table[index] < 3)
00515       p->table[index]++;
00516   }
00517   else
00518   {
00519     if(p->table[index] > 0)
00520       p->table[index]--;
00521   }
00522 }
00523 
00524 
00525 
00526 
00527 /* Check to see if a given address can be found in the cache.  This is only a "peek" function
00528    in that it does not update any hit/miss stats, although it does update replacement state. */
00529 struct cache_line_t * cache_is_hit_llc(
00530     struct cache_t * const cp,
00531     const enum cache_command cmd,
00532     const md_paddr_t addr,
00533     struct core_t * const core)
00534 {
00535   const md_paddr_t block_addr = addr >> cp->addr_shift;
00536   const int index = block_addr & (cp->sets-1);
00537   struct cache_line_t * p = cp->blocks[index];
00538   struct cache_line_t * prev = NULL;
00539 
00540   while(p) /* search all of the ways */
00541   {
00542     if(p->valid && (p->tag == block_addr)) /* hit */
00543     {
00544       if(cmd != CACHE_WRITEBACK)
00545         switch(cp->replacement_policy)
00546         {
00547           case REPLACE_PLRU: /* tree-based pseudo-LRU */
00548           {
00549             int bitmask = cp->blocks[index][0].meta;
00550             const int way = p->way;
00551             for(int i=0;i<cp->log2_assoc;i++)
00552             {
00553               const int pos = (way >> (cp->log2_assoc-i)) + (1<<i);
00554               
00555               if((way>>(cp->log2_assoc-i-1)) & 1)
00556                 bitmask |= (1<<pos);
00557               else
00558                 bitmask &= ~(1<<pos);
00559             }
00560             cp->blocks[index][0].meta = bitmask;
00561           }
00562             /* NO BREAK IN THE CASE STATEMENT HERE: Do the LRU ordering, too.
00563                This doesn't affect the behavior of the replacement policy, but
00564                for highly-associative caches it'll speed up any subsequent
00565                searches (assuming temporal locality) */
00566 
00567           case REPLACE_RANDOM: /* similar: random doesn't need it, but this can speed up searches */
00568           case REPLACE_LRU:
00569           case REPLACE_NMRU:
00570             {
00571               if(prev) /* insert back at front of list */
00572               {
00573                 prev->next = p->next;
00574                 p->next = cp->blocks[index];
00575                 cp->blocks[index] = p;
00576               }
00577               break;
00578             }
00579           case REPLACE_MRU:
00580             {
00581               if(p->next) /* only move node if not already at end of list */
00582               {
00583                 /* remove node */
00584                 if(prev)
00585                   prev->next = p->next;
00586                 else
00587                   cp->blocks[index] = p->next;
00588 
00589                 /* go to end of list */
00590                 prev = p->next;
00591                 while(prev->next)
00592                   prev = prev->next;
00593                 
00594                 /* stick ourselves there */
00595                 prev->next = p;
00596                 p->next = NULL;
00597               }
00598               break;
00599             }
00600           case REPLACE_CLOCK:
00601           {
00602             cp->blocks[index][0].meta |= 1ULL<<p->way; /* set referenced bit */
00603             break;
00604           }
00605           default:
00606             fatal("policy not yet implemented");
00607         }
00608 
00609       if(cmd == CACHE_WRITE || cmd == CACHE_WRITEBACK)
00610       {
00611         cache_assert(cp->read_only != CACHE_READONLY,NULL);
00612         if(cp->write_policy == WRITE_BACK) /* write-thru doesn't have dirty lines */
00613           p->dirty = true;
00614       }
00615 
00616       return p;
00617     }
00618     prev = p;
00619     p = p->next;
00620   }
00621 
00622   /* miss */
00623   return NULL;
00624 }
00625 
00626 /* Check to see if a given address can be found in the cache.  This is a *true* "peek"
00627    function; the replacement state is not touched. */
00628 static struct cache_line_t * cache_peek_llc(
00629     const struct cache_t * const cp,
00630     const md_paddr_t addr)
00631 {
00632   const md_paddr_t block_addr = addr >> cp->addr_shift;
00633   const int index = block_addr & (cp->sets-1);
00634   struct cache_line_t * p = cp->blocks[index];
00635 
00636   while(p) /* search all of the ways */
00637   {
00638     if(p->valid && (p->tag == block_addr)) /* hit */
00639     {
00640       return p;
00641     }
00642     p = p->next;
00643   }
00644 
00645   /* miss */
00646   return NULL;
00647 }
00648 
00649 /* Overwrite the victim line with a new block.  This function only gets called after
00650    the previous evictee (as determined by the replacement policy) has already been
00651    removed, which means there is at least one invalid line (which we use for the
00652    newly inserted line). */
00653 void cache_insert_block_llc(
00654     struct cache_t * const cp,
00655     const enum cache_command cmd,
00656     const md_paddr_t addr,
00657     core_t * const core)
00658 {
00659   /* assumes block not already present */
00660   const md_paddr_t block_addr = addr >> cp->addr_shift;
00661   const int index = block_addr & (cp->sets-1);
00662   struct cache_line_t * p = cp->blocks[index];
00663   struct cache_line_t *prev = NULL;
00664 
00665   /* there had better be an invalid line now - cache_get_evictee should
00666      have already returned a line to be invalidated */
00667   while(p)
00668   {
00669     if(!p->valid)
00670       break;
00671     prev = p;
00672     p = p->next;
00673   }
00674 
00675   cache_assert(p,(void)0);
00676   p->tag = block_addr;
00677   p->core = core;
00678   p->valid = true;
00679   if(cmd == CACHE_WRITE || cmd == CACHE_WRITEBACK)
00680     p->dirty = true;
00681   else
00682     p->dirty = false;
00683   if(cmd == CACHE_PREFETCH)
00684   {
00685     p->prefetched = true;
00686     CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.prefetch_insertions++;)
00687   }
00688 
00689   if(cmd != CACHE_WRITEBACK) /* writebacks don't update replacement state */
00690   {
00691     switch(cp->replacement_policy)
00692     {
00693       case REPLACE_PLRU: /* tree-based pseudo-LRU */
00694       {
00695         int bitmask = cp->blocks[index][0].meta;
00696         const int way = p->way;
00697         for(int i=0;i<cp->log2_assoc;i++)
00698         {
00699           int pos = (way >> (cp->log2_assoc-i)) + (1<<i);
00700           
00701           if((way>>(cp->log2_assoc-i-1)) & 1)
00702             bitmask |= (1<<pos);
00703           else
00704             bitmask &= ~(1<<pos);
00705         }
00706         cp->blocks[index][0].meta = bitmask;
00707       }
00708       /* same comment about case statement fall-through as in cache_is_hit() */
00709       case REPLACE_RANDOM:
00710       case REPLACE_LRU:
00711       case REPLACE_NMRU:
00712         if(prev) /* put to front of list */
00713         {
00714           prev->next = p->next;
00715           p->next = cp->blocks[index];
00716           cp->blocks[index] = p;
00717         }
00718         break;
00719       case REPLACE_MRU:
00720         if(p->next) /* only move node if not already at end of list */
00721         {
00722           /* remove node */
00723           if(prev)
00724             prev->next = p->next;
00725           else
00726             cp->blocks[index] = p->next;
00727 
00728           /* go to end of list */
00729           prev = p->next;
00730           while(prev->next)
00731             prev = prev->next;
00732           
00733           /* stick ourselves there */
00734           prev->next = p;
00735           p->next = NULL;
00736         }
00737         break;
00738       case REPLACE_CLOCK:
00739       {
00740         /* do not set referenced bit */
00741         break;
00742       }
00743       default:
00744         fatal("policy not yet implemented");
00745     }
00746   }
00747 }
00748 
00749 /* caller of get_evictee is responsible for writing back (if needed) and
00750    invalidating the entry prior to inserting a new block */
00751 struct cache_line_t * cache_get_evictee_llc(
00752     struct cache_t * const cp,
00753     const md_paddr_t addr,
00754     core_t * const core)
00755 {
00756   int block_addr = addr >> cp->addr_shift;
00757   int index = block_addr & (cp->sets-1);
00758   struct cache_line_t * p = cp->blocks[index];
00759 
00760   switch(cp->replacement_policy)
00761   {
00762     /* this works for both LRU and MRU, since MRU just sorts its recency list backwards */
00763     case REPLACE_LRU:
00764     case REPLACE_MRU:
00765     {
00766       while(p)
00767       {
00768         if(!p->next || !p->valid) /* take any invalid line, else take the last one (LRU) */
00769           return p;
00770 
00771         p = p->next;
00772       }
00773       break;
00774     }
00775     case REPLACE_RANDOM:
00776     {
00777       /* use an invalid block if possible */
00778       while(p)
00779       {
00780         if(!p->valid) /* take any invalid line */
00781           return p;
00782 
00783         p = p->next;
00784       }
00785 
00786       if(!p) /* no invalid line, pick at random */
00787       {
00788         const int pos = random() % cp->assoc;
00789         p = cp->blocks[index];
00790 
00791         for(int i=0;i<pos;i++)
00792           p = p->next;
00793 
00794         return p;
00795       }
00796 
00797       break;
00798     }
00799     case REPLACE_NMRU:
00800     {
00801       /* use an invalid block if possible */
00802       while(p)
00803       {
00804         if(!p->valid) /* take any invalid line */
00805           return p;
00806         p = p->next;
00807       }
00808 
00809       if((cp->assoc > 1) && !p) /* no invalid line, pick at random from non-MRU */
00810       {
00811         const int pos = random() % (cp->assoc-1);
00812         p = cp->blocks[index];
00813         p = p->next; /* skip MRU */
00814 
00815         for(int i=0;i<pos;i++)
00816           p = p->next;
00817       }
00818       return p;
00819     }
00820     case REPLACE_PLRU:
00821     {
00822       int bitmask = cp->blocks[index][0].meta;
00823       int i;
00824       int node = 1;
00825 
00826       while(p)
00827       {
00828         if(!p->valid) /* take any invalid line */
00829           return p;
00830         p = p->next;
00831       }
00832 
00833       for(i=0;i<cp->log2_assoc;i++)
00834       {
00835         const int bit = (bitmask >> node) & 1;
00836 
00837         node = (node<<1) + !bit;
00838       }
00839 
00840       const int way = node & ~(1<<cp->log2_assoc);
00841 
00842       p = cp->blocks[index];
00843       for(i=0;i<cp->assoc;i++)
00844       {
00845         if(p->way==way)
00846           break;
00847         p = p->next;
00848       }
00849 
00850       return p;
00851     }
00852     case REPLACE_CLOCK:
00853     {
00854       int just_in_case = 0;
00855 
00856       while(1)
00857       {
00858         qword_t way = cp->blocks[index][1].meta;
00859         struct cache_line_t * p = &cp->blocks[index][way];
00860 
00861         /* increment clock */
00862         cp->blocks[index][1].meta = modinc(way,cp->assoc); //(way+1) % cp->assoc;
00863 
00864         if(!p->valid) /* take any invalid line */
00865         {
00866           cp->blocks[index][0].meta &= ~(1ULL<<p->way); /* make sure referenced bit is clear */
00867           return p;
00868         }
00869         else if(!((cp->blocks[index][0].meta >> p->way) & 1)) /* not referenced */
00870         {
00871           return p;
00872         }
00873         else
00874         {
00875           cp->blocks[index][0].meta &= ~(1ULL<<p->way); /* clear referenced bit */
00876         }
00877 
00878         just_in_case++;
00879         if(just_in_case > (2*cp->assoc))
00880           fatal("Clock-PLRU has gone around twice without finding an evictee for %s",cp->name);
00881       }
00882     }
00883     default:
00884       fatal("policy not yet implemented");
00885   }
00886 
00887   fatal("unreachable code");
00888 }
00889 
00890 
00891 /* input state: assumes that the new node has just been inserted at
00892    insert_position and all remaining nodes obey the heap property */
00893 static void cache_heap_balance(
00894     struct cache_action_t * const pipe,
00895     const int insert_position)
00896 {
00897   int pos = insert_position;
00898   //struct cache_action_t tmp;
00899   while(pos > 1)
00900   {
00901     int parent = pos >> 1;
00902     if(pipe[parent].pipe_exit_time > pipe[pos].pipe_exit_time)
00903     {
00904       /*
00905       tmp = pipe[parent];
00906       pipe[parent] = pipe[pos];
00907       pipe[pos] = tmp;
00908       */
00909       memswap(&pipe[parent],&pipe[pos],sizeof(*pipe));
00910       pos = parent;
00911     }
00912     else
00913       return;
00914   }
00915 }
00916 
00917 /* input state: pipe_num is the number of elements in the heap
00918    prior to removing the root node. */
00919 static void cache_heap_remove(
00920     struct cache_action_t * const pipe,
00921     const int pipe_num)
00922 {
00923   if(pipe_num == 1) /* only one node to remove */
00924   {
00925     pipe[1].cb = NULL;
00926     pipe[1].pipe_exit_time = TICK_T_MAX;
00927     return;
00928   }
00929 
00930   pipe[1] = pipe[pipe_num]; /* move last node to root */
00931   //struct cache_action_t tmp;
00932 
00933   /* delete previous last node */
00934   pipe[pipe_num].cb = NULL;
00935   pipe[pipe_num].pipe_exit_time = TICK_T_MAX;
00936 
00937   /* push node down until heap property re-established */
00938   int pos = 1;
00939   while(1)
00940   {
00941     int Lindex = pos<<1;     // index of left child
00942     int Rindex = (pos<<1)+1; // index of right child
00943     tick_t myValue = pipe[pos].pipe_exit_time;
00944 
00945     tick_t Lvalue = TICK_T_MAX;
00946     tick_t Rvalue = TICK_T_MAX;
00947     if(Lindex < pipe_num) /* valid index */
00948       Lvalue = pipe[Lindex].pipe_exit_time;
00949     if(Rindex < pipe_num) /* valid index */
00950       Rvalue = pipe[Rindex].pipe_exit_time;
00951 
00952     if(((myValue > Lvalue) && (Lvalue != TICK_T_MAX)) ||
00953        ((myValue > Rvalue) && (Rvalue != TICK_T_MAX)))
00954     {
00955       if(Rvalue == TICK_T_MAX) /* swap pos with L */
00956       {
00957         /* tmp = pipe[Lindex];
00958         pipe[Lindex] = pipe[pos];
00959         pipe[pos] = tmp; */
00960         memswap(&pipe[Lindex],&pipe[pos],sizeof(*pipe));
00961         return;
00962       }
00963       else if((myValue > Lvalue) && (Lvalue < Rvalue))
00964       {
00965         /* tmp = pipe[Lindex];
00966         pipe[Lindex] = pipe[pos];
00967         pipe[pos] = tmp; */
00968         memswap(&pipe[Lindex],&pipe[pos],sizeof(*pipe));
00969         pos = Lindex;
00970       }
00971       else /* swap pos with R */
00972       {
00973         /* tmp = pipe[Rindex];
00974         pipe[Rindex] = pipe[pos];
00975         pipe[pos] = tmp; */
00976         memswap(&pipe[Rindex],&pipe[pos],sizeof(*pipe));
00977         pos = Rindex;
00978       }
00979     }
00980     else
00981       return;
00982   }
00983 }
00984 
00985 
00986 /* Can a cache access get enqueued into the cache?  Returns true if it
00987    can.  Cases when it can't include, for example, more than one request
00988    per cycle goes to the same bank, or if a bank has been locked up. */
00989 int cache_enqueuable_llc(
00990     const struct cache_t * const cp,
00991     const int thread_id,
00992     const md_paddr_t addr)
00993 {
00994   md_paddr_t paddr;
00995   if(thread_id == DO_NOT_TRANSLATE)
00996     paddr = addr;
00997   else
00998     paddr = addr;       //v2p_translate(thread_id,addr);
00999   const int bank = GET_BANK(paddr);
01000   if(cp->pipe_num[bank] < cp->latency)
01001     return true;
01002   else
01003     return false;
01004 }
01005 
01006 /* Enqueue a cache access request to the cache.  Assumes you already
01007    called cache_enqueuable. */
01008 void cache_enqueue_llc(
01009     struct core_t * const core,
01010     struct cache_t * const cp,
01011     struct cache_t * const prev_cp,
01012     const enum cache_command cmd,
01013     const int thread_id,
01014     const md_addr_t PC,
01015     const md_paddr_t addr,
01016     const seq_t action_id,
01017     const int MSHR_bank,
01018     const int MSHR_index,
01019     void * const op,
01020     void (*const cb)(void *),
01021     void (*const miss_cb)(void *, int),
01022     bool (*const translated_cb)(void *,seq_t),
01023     seq_t (*const get_action_id)(void *) )
01024 {
01025   md_paddr_t paddr;
01026 
01027   //if(strcmp(cp->name,"IL1")==0)
01028         //fprintf(stdout,"\n[%lld]IL1 enqueue_llc %llx cmd %d ",sim_cycle, addr, cmd );
01029 
01030   //if(strcmp(cp->name,"DL1")==0)
01031         //fprintf(stdout,"\n[%lld]DL1 enqueue_llc %llx cmd %d ",sim_cycle, addr, cmd );
01032 
01033   //if(strcmp(cp->name,"LLC")==0)
01034         //fprintf(stdout,"\n[%lld][UnCore%d]LLC enqueue_llc %llx cmd %d ",sim_cycle,cp->uncore->node_ip, addr, cmd );
01035 
01036 
01037 
01038   if(thread_id == DO_NOT_TRANSLATE)
01039     paddr = addr;
01040   else
01041     paddr = addr;       //v2p_translate(thread_id,addr); /* for the IL1/DL1, we need a virtual-to-physical translation */
01042   const int bank = GET_BANK(paddr);
01043 
01044   /* heap initial insertion position */
01045   const int insert_position = cp->pipe_num[bank]+1;
01046   cache_assert(cp->pipe[bank][insert_position].cb == NULL,(void)0);
01047   cache_assert(cb != NULL,(void)0);
01048 
01049   cp->pipe[bank][insert_position].core = core;
01050   cp->pipe[bank][insert_position].prev_cp = prev_cp;
01051   cp->pipe[bank][insert_position].cmd = cmd;
01052   cp->pipe[bank][insert_position].PC = PC;
01053   cp->pipe[bank][insert_position].paddr = paddr;
01054   cp->pipe[bank][insert_position].op = op;
01055   cp->pipe[bank][insert_position].action_id = action_id;
01056   cp->pipe[bank][insert_position].MSHR_bank = MSHR_bank;
01057   cp->pipe[bank][insert_position].MSHR_index = MSHR_index;
01058   cp->pipe[bank][insert_position].cb = cb;
01059   cp->pipe[bank][insert_position].miss_cb = miss_cb;
01060   cp->pipe[bank][insert_position].translated_cb = translated_cb;
01061   cp->pipe[bank][insert_position].get_action_id = get_action_id;
01062   cp->pipe[bank][insert_position].when_started = sim_cycle;
01063   cp->pipe[bank][insert_position].when_returned = TICK_T_MAX;
01064 
01065 
01066   cp->pipe[bank][insert_position].pipe_exit_time = sim_cycle+cp->latency;
01067 
01068   cp->pipe[bank][insert_position].miss_cb_invoked = false;
01069 
01070   assert(insert_position < cp->heap_size);
01071   cache_heap_balance(cp->pipe[bank],insert_position);
01072 
01073   cp->pipe_num[bank]++;
01074   //cache_assert(cp->pipe_num[bank] <= cp->latency,(void)0);
01075 
01076   cp->check_for_work = true;
01077   cp->check_for_pipe_work = true;
01078 
01079 }
01080 
01081 /* Returns true if there's at least one free entry in the write-back buffer */
01082 static inline int WBB_available(
01083     const struct cache_t * const cp,
01084     const md_paddr_t paddr)
01085 {
01086   const int bank = GET_MSHR_BANK(paddr);
01087   return cp->WBB_num[bank] < cp->WBB_size;
01088 }
01089 
01090 /* Insert a writeback request into the WBB; assumes you already called WBB_available
01091    to make sure there's room. */
01092 static void WBB_insert(
01093     struct cache_t * const cp,
01094     struct cache_line_t * const cache_block)
01095 {
01096   /* don't need to cache invalid blocks */
01097   if(!cache_block->valid)
01098     return;
01099 
01100   CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.WBB_insertions++;)
01101   const int bank = GET_MSHR_BANK(cache_block->tag << cp->addr_shift);
01102 
01103   if(cp->write_combining)
01104   {
01105     int i;
01106     for(i=0;i<cp->WBB_num[bank];i++)
01107     {
01108       int index = mod2m(cp->WBB_head[bank]+i,cp->WBB_size); //(cp->WBB_head[bank] + i) % cp->WBB_size;
01109       if(cp->WBB[bank][index].valid && (cp->WBB[bank][index].tag == cache_block->tag))
01110       {
01111         /* if can combine with another write that's already
01112            waiting in the WBB, then don't need to add new request */
01113         CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.WBB_combines++;)
01114         return;
01115       }
01116     }
01117   }
01118 
01119   struct cache_line_t * p = &cp->WBB[bank][cp->WBB_tail[bank]];
01120 
01121   p->core = cache_block->core;
01122   p->tag = cache_block->tag;
01123   p->valid = cache_block->valid;
01124   p->dirty = cache_block->dirty;
01125   p->victim = false;
01126 
01127   cp->WBB_num[bank]++;
01128   cache_assert(cp->WBB_num[bank] <= cp->WBB_size,(void)0);
01129   cp->WBB_tail[bank] = modinc(cp->WBB_tail[bank],cp->WBB_size); //(cp->WBB_tail[bank] + 1) % cp->WBB_size;
01130   cp->check_for_work = true;
01131   cp->check_for_WBB_work = true;
01132 }
01133 
01134 /* insert if room, but this line doesn't need to be written back to next level */
01135 static void WBB_victim_insert(
01136     struct cache_t * const cp,
01137     struct cache_line_t * const cache_block)
01138 {
01139   /* don't need to cache invalid blocks */
01140   if(!cache_block->valid)
01141     return;
01142 
01143   const int bank = GET_MSHR_BANK(cache_block->tag << cp->addr_shift);
01144 
01145   if(cp->WBB_num[bank] >= cp->WBB_size) /* can't do anything if full */
01146     return;
01147 
01148   const int num_available = cp->WBB_size - cp->WBB_num[bank];
01149 
01150   /* random insertion among non-dirty lines */
01151   int index = mod2m(cp->WBB_head[bank]+cp->WBB_num[bank],cp->WBB_size); // tail index
01152   index += random() % num_available;
01153   index = mod2m(index,cp->WBB_size);
01154 
01155   struct cache_line_t * p = &cp->WBB[bank][index];
01156 
01157   /* Victim lines written to can end up out-of-order with respect to the
01158      regular circular queue order.  In this rare case, we just skip the
01159      victim insertion because we cannot overwrite the dirty line.  One could
01160      try to re-search for a non-dirty line, but that gets ugly. */
01161   if(p->dirty)
01162     return;
01163 
01164   CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.WBB_victim_insertions++;)
01165   p->core = cache_block->core;
01166   p->tag = cache_block->tag;
01167   p->valid = cache_block->valid;
01168   cache_assert(!cache_block->dirty,(void)0);
01169   p->dirty = false;
01170   p->victim = true;
01171 }
01172 
01173 /* Returns true if at least one MSHR entry is free/available. */
01174 static inline int MSHR_available(
01175     const struct cache_t * const cp,
01176     const md_paddr_t paddr)
01177 {
01178   const int bank = GET_MSHR_BANK(paddr);
01179   return cp->MSHR_num[bank] < cp->MSHR_size;
01180 }
01181 
01182 /* Returns a pointer to a free MSHR entry; assumes you already called
01183    MSHR_available to make sure there's room */
01184 static struct cache_action_t * MSHR_allocate(
01185     struct cache_t * const cp,
01186     const md_paddr_t paddr,
01187     const enum cache_command cmd)
01188 {
01189   const int bank = GET_MSHR_BANK(paddr);
01190 
01191   struct cache_action_t * prev = NULL;
01192 
01193   /* Check to see if there are any other requests to the same
01194      cache line; if so, coalesce the requests.  Note, this
01195      implementation of request-combining still uses one MSHR
01196      entry per request, but only one is sent to the next level
01197      of the cache hierarchy. */
01198   for(int i=0;i<cp->MSHR_size;i++)
01199   {
01200     if((cp->MSHR[bank][i].cb != NULL) && 
01201         (cp->MSHR[bank][i].paddr >> cp->addr_shift) == (paddr >> cp->addr_shift) &&
01202         (cp->MSHR[bank][i].MSHR_link == NULL) &&
01203         (cp->MSHR[bank][i].when_returned == TICK_T_MAX))
01204     {
01205       cp->stat.MSHR_combos++;
01206       prev = &cp->MSHR[bank][i];
01207       break;
01208     }
01209   }
01210 
01211   for(int i=0;i<cp->MSHR_size;i++)
01212     if(cp->MSHR[bank][i].cb == NULL)
01213     {
01214       cp->MSHR_num[bank]++;
01215       cache_assert(cp->MSHR_num[bank] <= cp->MSHR_size,NULL);
01216       cp->check_for_work = true;
01217       cp->check_for_MSHR_work = true;
01218       cache_assert(cp->MSHR[bank][i].MSHR_link == NULL,NULL);
01219       cp->MSHR[bank][i].MSHR_link = NULL;
01220       if(prev)
01221       {
01222         /* if this request can be combined with others,
01223            then link it onto the end of the chain */
01224         prev->MSHR_link = &cp->MSHR[bank][i];
01225         cp->MSHR[bank][i].when_returned = prev->when_returned;
01226         cp->MSHR[bank][i].MSHR_linked = true;
01227       }
01228       else
01229       {
01230         cp->MSHR[bank][i].MSHR_linked = false;
01231       }
01232       return &cp->MSHR[bank][i];
01233     }
01234 
01235   fatal("request for MSHR failed");
01236 }
01237 
01238 static void dummy_callback(void * p)
01239 {
01240   /* this is just a place holder for cast-out writebacks
01241      in a write-back cache */
01242 }
01243 
01244 /* Called when a LLC cache miss gets serviced. */
01245 void fill_arrived_llc(
01246     struct cache_t * const cp,
01247     unsigned long long int address)
01248 {
01249   bool flag=false;
01250   for(int b=0;b<cp->MSHR_banks;b++)
01251   {
01252       int bank = (b) & cp->MSHR_mask;
01253       if(cp->MSHR_fill_num[bank])
01254       {
01255         /* find oldest returned request to process */
01256         for(int i=0;i<cp->MSHR_size;i++)
01257         {
01258                 struct cache_action_t * MSHR = &cp->MSHR[bank][i];
01259                 if( (MSHR->paddr >> cp->addr_shift) == (address >> cp->addr_shift) )
01260                 {
01261                         flag=true;
01262                         if(MSHR->cb != NULL) /* original request was squashed */
01263                                 MSHR->when_returned = sim_cycle;
01264                         MSHR->MSHR_linked=false;
01265                         MSHR->MSHR_link=NULL;
01266                 }
01267         }
01268       }
01269   }
01270   if(!flag)
01271   {
01272         fprintf(stdout,"\nunknown %llx",address);
01273   }
01274 
01275   cp->check_for_work = true;
01276   cp->check_for_MSHR_fill_work = true;
01277 
01278  
01279   /* NOTE: recursive calls to fill_arrived will be called
01280      by the MSHR_fill handling code in cache_process */
01281 }
01282 
01283 
01284 /* input state: assumes that the new node has just been inserted at
01285    insert_position and all remaining nodes obey the heap property */
01286 static void fill_heap_balance(
01287     struct cache_fill_t * const pipe,
01288     const int insert_position)
01289 {
01290   int pos = insert_position;
01291   //struct cache_fill_t tmp;
01292   while(pos > 1)
01293   {
01294     int parent = pos >> 1;
01295     if(pipe[parent].pipe_exit_time > pipe[pos].pipe_exit_time)
01296     {
01297       /* tmp = pipe[parent];
01298       pipe[parent] = pipe[pos];
01299       pipe[pos] = tmp; */
01300       memswap(&pipe[parent],&pipe[pos],sizeof(*pipe));
01301       pos = parent;
01302     }
01303     else
01304       return;
01305   }
01306 }
01307 
01308 /* input state: pipe_num is the number of elements in the heap
01309    prior to removing the root node. */
01310 static void fill_heap_remove(
01311     struct cache_fill_t * const pipe,
01312     const int pipe_num)
01313 {
01314   if(pipe_num == 1) /* only one node to remove */
01315   {
01316     pipe[1].valid = false;
01317     pipe[1].pipe_exit_time = TICK_T_MAX;
01318     return;
01319   }
01320 
01321   pipe[1] = pipe[pipe_num]; /* move last node to root */
01322   //struct cache_fill_t tmp;
01323 
01324   /* delete previous last node */
01325   pipe[pipe_num].valid = false;
01326   pipe[pipe_num].pipe_exit_time = TICK_T_MAX;
01327 
01328   /* push node down until heap property re-established */
01329   int pos = 1;
01330   while(1)
01331   {
01332     int Lindex = pos<<1;     // index of left child
01333     int Rindex = (pos<<1)+1; // index of right child
01334     tick_t myValue = pipe[pos].pipe_exit_time;
01335 
01336     tick_t Lvalue = TICK_T_MAX;
01337     tick_t Rvalue = TICK_T_MAX;
01338     if(Lindex < pipe_num) /* valid index */
01339       Lvalue = pipe[Lindex].pipe_exit_time;
01340     if(Rindex < pipe_num) /* valid index */
01341       Rvalue = pipe[Rindex].pipe_exit_time;
01342 
01343     if(((myValue > Lvalue) && (Lvalue != TICK_T_MAX)) ||
01344        ((myValue > Rvalue) && (Rvalue != TICK_T_MAX)))
01345     {
01346       if(Rvalue == TICK_T_MAX) /* swap pos with L */
01347       {
01348         /* tmp = pipe[Lindex];
01349         pipe[Lindex] = pipe[pos];
01350         pipe[pos] = tmp; */
01351         memswap(&pipe[Lindex],&pipe[pos],sizeof(*pipe));
01352         return;
01353       }
01354       else if((myValue > Lvalue) && (Lvalue < Rvalue))
01355       {
01356         /* tmp = pipe[Lindex];
01357         pipe[Lindex] = pipe[pos];
01358         pipe[pos] = tmp; */
01359         memswap(&pipe[Lindex],&pipe[pos],sizeof(*pipe));
01360         pos = Lindex;
01361       }
01362       else /* swap pos with R */
01363       {
01364         /* tmp = pipe[Rindex];
01365         pipe[Rindex] = pipe[pos];
01366         pipe[pos] = tmp; */
01367         memswap(&pipe[Rindex],&pipe[pos],sizeof(*pipe));
01368         pos = Rindex;
01369       }
01370     }
01371     else
01372       return;
01373   }
01374 }
01375 
01376 
01377 /* We are assuming separate ports for cache fills; returns true if the fill pipeline
01378    can accept a fill request. */
01379 static inline bool cache_fillable_llc(
01380     const struct cache_t * const cp,
01381     const md_paddr_t paddr)
01382 {
01383   const int bank = GET_BANK(paddr);
01384   if(cp->fill_num[bank] < cp->latency)
01385     return true;
01386   else
01387     return false;
01388 }
01389 
01390 /* Do the actual fill; assume you already called cache_fillable */
01391 static inline void cache_fill_llc(
01392     struct cache_t * const cp,
01393     const enum cache_command cmd,
01394     const md_paddr_t paddr,
01395     struct core_t * core)
01396 {
01397   const int bank = GET_BANK(paddr);
01398   const int insert_position = cp->fill_num[bank]+1;
01399   cache_assert(!cp->fill_pipe[bank][insert_position].valid,(void)0);
01400 
01401 
01402   //if(strcmp(cp->name,"LLC")==0)
01403         //fprintf(stdout,"\n[%lld]LLC fill_llc %llx cmd %d ",sim_cycle, paddr, cmd );
01404 
01405   cp->fill_pipe[bank][insert_position].valid = true;
01406   cp->fill_pipe[bank][insert_position].cmd = cmd;
01407   cp->fill_pipe[bank][insert_position].paddr = paddr;
01408   cp->fill_pipe[bank][insert_position].core = core;
01409 
01410   cp->fill_pipe[bank][insert_position].pipe_exit_time = sim_cycle+cp->latency;
01411 
01412   assert(insert_position < cp->heap_size);
01413   fill_heap_balance(cp->fill_pipe[bank],insert_position);
01414 
01415   cp->fill_num[bank]++;
01416   cache_assert(cp->fill_num[bank] <= cp->latency,(void)0);
01417   cp->check_for_work = true;
01418   cp->check_for_fill_work = true;
01419 }
01420 
01421 /* simulate one cycle of the cache */
01422 void cache_process_llc(struct cache_t * const cp)
01423 {
01424   int b;
01425 
01426   bool work_found = false;
01427   bool MSHR_fill_work_found = false;
01428   bool fill_work_found = false;
01429   bool pipe_work_found = false;
01430   bool MSHR_work_found = false;
01431   bool WBB_work_found = false;
01432 
01433 
01434 
01435 //if(cp->uncore->id==2)
01436 /*if(1)
01437 {
01438   fprintf(stdout,"\n[%lld][Uncore%d] MSHR entries :",sim_cycle,cp->uncore->node_ip);
01439   for(int b=0;b<cp->MSHR_banks;b++)
01440   {
01441         fprintf(stdout,"%d ", cp->MSHR_fill_num[b]);
01442                 for(int i=0;i<cp->MSHR_size;i++)
01443                         if(cp->MSHR[b][i].when_returned==TICK_T_MAX)
01444                                 fprintf(stdout,"\n %llx ",cp->MSHR[b][i].paddr);
01445                 //exit(0);
01446   }
01447 }*/
01448   //int start_point = random() & cp->bank_mask; /* randomized arbitration */
01449   int start_point = cp->start_point; /* round-robin arbitration */
01450   cp->start_point = modinc(cp->start_point,cp->banks);
01451 
01452   /* process write-backs */
01453   if(cp->check_for_WBB_work)
01454     for(b=0;b<cp->MSHR_banks;b++)
01455     {
01456       int bank = (start_point+b) & cp->MSHR_mask;
01457       if(cp->WBB_num[bank]) /* there are cast-outs pending to be written back */
01458       {
01459         struct cache_line_t * WBB = &cp->WBB[bank][cp->WBB_head[bank]];
01460 
01461         work_found = true;
01462         WBB_work_found = true;
01463         
01464         /* write back to main memory */
01465         if(cp->uncore->enqueuable())
01466         {
01467           //fprintf(stdout,"\n[%lld][UnCore%d]Uncore Enqueue 0x%llx",sim_cycle,cp->uncore->node_ip,WBB->tag);
01468           cp->uncore->enqueue(NULL,CACHE_WRITEBACK,WBB->tag << cp->addr_shift,cp->linesize,(md_paddr_t)-1,0,NO_MSHR,NULL,NULL,NULL);
01469 
01470           WBB->dirty = false;
01471           WBB->dirty = false;
01472           cp->WBB_num[bank] --;
01473           cache_assert(cp->WBB_num[bank] >= 0,(void)0);
01474           cp->WBB_head[bank] = modinc(cp->WBB_head[bank],cp->WBB_size); //(cp->WBB_head[bank] + 1) % cp->WBB_size;
01475         }
01476         
01477       }
01478     }
01479   cp->check_for_WBB_work = WBB_work_found;
01480 
01481 
01482 
01483   /*Check if any spills have arrived from memory*/
01484   if(cp->check_for_MSHR_fill_work)
01485     for(int b=0;b<cp->MSHR_banks;b++)
01486     {
01487       int bank = (start_point + b) & cp->MSHR_mask;
01488       if(cp->MSHR_fill_num[bank])
01489       {
01490         work_found = true;
01491         MSHR_fill_work_found = true;
01492         tick_t oldest = TICK_T_MAX;
01493         int old_index = -1;
01494 
01495         /* find oldest returned request to process */
01496         for(int i=0;i<cp->MSHR_size;i++)
01497         {
01498           struct cache_action_t * MSHR = &cp->MSHR[bank][i];
01499           if(MSHR->cb && (MSHR->when_returned <= sim_cycle) &&
01500                   cache_fillable_llc(cp,MSHR->paddr))
01501           {
01502             if(MSHR->when_enqueued < oldest)
01503             {
01504               oldest = MSHR->when_enqueued;
01505               old_index = i;
01506             }
01507           }
01508         }
01509 
01510         if(old_index < 0)
01511           continue;
01512 
01513         /* process returned MSHR requests that now need to fill the cache */
01514         struct cache_action_t * MSHR = &cp->MSHR[bank][old_index];
01515         bool bus_available = !MSHR->prev_cp || bus_free(MSHR->prev_cp->next_bus);
01516 
01517         if(MSHR->cb && (MSHR->when_returned <= sim_cycle) && bus_available)
01518         {
01519           if(!MSHR->MSHR_linked)
01520           {
01521             int insert = true;
01522             if(cp->PF_filter && (MSHR->cmd == CACHE_PREFETCH))
01523               insert = prefetch_filter_lookup(cp->PF_filter,(MSHR->paddr>>cp->addr_shift));
01524 
01525             /* if using prefetch buffer, insert there instead */
01526             if((MSHR->cmd == CACHE_PREFETCH) && (cp->PF_buffer) && insert)
01527             {
01528               struct prefetch_buffer_t *p, *evictee = NULL, *prev = NULL;
01529               p = cp->PF_buffer;
01530               while(p)
01531               {
01532                 if((MSHR->paddr>>cp->addr_shift) == (p->addr>>cp->addr_shift)) /* already been prefetched */
01533                   break;
01534                 if(!p->next || (p->addr == (md_paddr_t)-1))
01535                 {
01536                   evictee = p;
01537                   break;
01538                 }
01539                 prev = p;
01540                 p = p->next;
01541               }
01542 
01543               if(evictee) /* not found, overwrite entry */
01544                 p->addr = MSHR->paddr;
01545 
01546               /* else someone else already prefetched this addr */
01547               /* move to MRU position if not already there */
01548               if(prev)
01549               {
01550                 prev->next = p->next;
01551                 p->next = cp->PF_buffer;
01552                 cp->PF_buffer = p;
01553               }
01554             }
01555             else if(  (MSHR->cmd == CACHE_READ) || (MSHR->cmd == CACHE_PREFETCH) ||
01556                      ((MSHR->cmd == CACHE_WRITE || MSHR->cmd == CACHE_WRITEBACK) && (cp->allocate_policy == WRITE_ALLOC)))
01557             {
01558               if(insert)
01559                 cache_fill_llc(cp,MSHR->cmd,MSHR->paddr,MSHR->core);
01560             }
01561           }
01562 
01563           if(MSHR->prev_cp)
01564           {
01565             /* everyone but the response from a writeback transfers a full cache line */
01566             bus_use(MSHR->prev_cp->next_bus,(MSHR->cmd==CACHE_WRITEBACK)?1:MSHR->prev_cp->linesize,MSHR->cmd==CACHE_PREFETCH);
01567             fill_arrived(MSHR->prev_cp,MSHR->MSHR_bank,MSHR->MSHR_index);
01568           }
01569 
01570           /* deallocate the MSHR */
01571           if(MSHR->cmd == CACHE_PREFETCH)
01572           {
01573             cp->MSHR_num_pf[bank]--;
01574             cache_assert(cp->MSHR_num_pf[bank] >= 0,(void)0);
01575           }
01576           MSHR->cb = NULL;
01577           cp->MSHR_num[bank]--;
01578           cp->MSHR_fill_num[bank]--;
01579           cache_assert(cp->MSHR_num[bank] >= 0,(void)0);
01580           cache_assert(cp->MSHR_fill_num[bank] >= 0,(void)0);
01581         }
01582       }
01583     }
01584   cp->check_for_MSHR_fill_work = MSHR_fill_work_found;
01585 
01586 
01587   /* process cache fills: */
01588   if(cp->check_for_fill_work)
01589     for(b=0;b<cp->banks;b++)
01590     {
01591       int bank = (start_point + b) & cp->bank_mask;
01592 
01593       struct cache_fill_t * cf = &cp->fill_pipe[bank][1];
01594       if(cp->fill_num[bank])
01595       {
01596         work_found = true;
01597         fill_work_found = true;
01598         if(cf->valid && cf->pipe_exit_time <= sim_cycle)
01599         {
01600           if(!cache_peek_llc(cp,cf->paddr)) /* make sure hasn't been filled in the meantime */
01601           {
01602             struct cache_line_t * p = cache_get_evictee_llc(cp,cf->paddr,cf->core);
01603             if(p->valid)
01604             {
01605               if(p->dirty)
01606               {
01607                 if(cp->write_policy == WRITE_BACK)
01608                 {
01609                   if(!WBB_available(cp,cf->paddr))
01610                     goto no_WBB_available; /* can't go until WBB is available */
01611                   WBB_insert(cp,p);
01612                 }
01613               }//TODO: invalidate the higher level of caches
01614             }
01615 
01616             if(p->prefetched && cp->PF_filter)
01617             {
01618               prefetch_filter_update(cp->PF_filter,p->tag,p->prefetch_used);
01619             }
01620             p->valid = p->dirty = false; /* this removes the copy in the cache since the WBB has it now */
01621 
01622             cache_insert_block_llc(cp,cf->cmd,cf->paddr,cf->core);
01623           }
01624           fill_heap_remove(cp->fill_pipe[bank],cp->fill_num[bank]);
01625           cp->fill_num[bank]--;
01626           cache_assert(cp->fill_num[bank] >= 0,(void)0);
01627         }
01628       }
01629     no_WBB_available:
01630       ;
01631     }
01632   cp->check_for_fill_work = fill_work_found;
01633 
01634 
01635 
01636   /* check last stage of cache pipes, process accesses */
01637   if(cp->check_for_pipe_work)
01638     for(b=0;b<cp->banks;b++)
01639     {
01640       int bank = (start_point + b) & cp->bank_mask;
01641 
01642       struct cache_action_t * ca = &cp->pipe[bank][1]; // heap root
01643       if(cp->pipe_num[bank])
01644       {
01645         /* These two determine whether to check the prefetcher(s) for
01646            new address(es) to prefetch.  We only do so when the request
01647            leaves the cache-lookup pipeline (request dequeued) to prevent
01648            double-prefetching */
01649         bool do_prefetch = !cp->prefetch_on_miss;
01650         bool request_dequeued = false;
01651 
01652         work_found = true;
01653         pipe_work_found = true;
01654         if(ca->cb)
01655         {
01656           if(ca->pipe_exit_time <= sim_cycle)
01657           {
01658             struct cache_line_t * line = cache_is_hit_llc(cp,ca->cmd,ca->paddr,ca->core);
01659             if(line != NULL) /* if cache hit */
01660             {
01661               if((ca->cmd == CACHE_WRITE || ca->cmd == CACHE_WRITEBACK) && (cp->write_policy == WRITE_THROUGH))
01662               {
01663                 if(!WBB_available(cp,ca->paddr))
01664                   continue; /* can't go until WBB is available */
01665 
01666                 struct cache_line_t tmp_line;
01667                 tmp_line.core = ca->core;
01668                 tmp_line.tag = ca->paddr >> cp->addr_shift;
01669                 tmp_line.valid = true;
01670                 tmp_line.dirty = false;
01671 
01672                 /* on a write-through cache, use a WBB entry to send write to the next level */
01673                 WBB_insert(cp,&tmp_line);
01674               }
01675 
01676               /* For L1 caches only: (L2/LLC handled by MSHR processing later)
01677                  invoke the call-back function; the action-id check makes sure the request is
01678                  still valid (e.g., a request is invalid if the original uop that initiated
01679                  the request had been flushed due to a branch misprediction). */
01680               if(!ca->prev_cp && ca->op && (ca->action_id == ca->get_action_id(ca->op)))
01681               {
01682                 ca->cb(ca->op);
01683               }
01684 
01685               if((cp == cp->uncore->LLC) && (ca->core))
01686                 CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.core_lookups[ca->core->current_thread->id]++;)
01687 
01688               if(ca->cmd == CACHE_PREFETCH)
01689                 CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.prefetch_lookups++;)
01690               else
01691               {
01692                 if(ca->cmd == CACHE_READ)
01693                   CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.load_lookups++;)
01694                 else if(ca->cmd == CACHE_WRITE)
01695                   CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.store_lookups++;)
01696                 else if(ca->cmd == CACHE_WRITEBACK)
01697                   CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.writeback_lookups++;)
01698                 if(line->prefetched && !line->prefetch_used)
01699                 {
01700                   line->prefetch_used = true;
01701                   CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.prefetch_useful_insertions++;)
01702                 }
01703               }
01704 
01705               /* fill previous level as appropriate */
01706               if(ca->prev_cp)
01707                 fill_arrived(ca->prev_cp,ca->MSHR_bank,ca->MSHR_index);
01708             }
01709             else /* miss in main data array */
01710             {
01711               int last_chance_hit = false;
01712 
01713               if((ca->cmd == CACHE_READ) ||
01714                  (ca->cmd == CACHE_PREFETCH) ||
01715                  ((ca->cmd == CACHE_WRITE || ca->cmd == CACHE_WRITEBACK) && cp->write_combining))
01716               {
01717                 /* last chance: check in WBBs - this implements something like a victim cache */
01718                 int j;
01719 
01720                 int this_bank = GET_MSHR_BANK(ca->paddr);
01721                 int index = cp->WBB_head[this_bank];
01722                 for(j=0;j<cp->WBB_size;j++)
01723                 {
01724                   if(cp->WBB[this_bank][index].tag == (ca->paddr >> cp->addr_shift))
01725                   {
01726                     /* we're only write-combining with other existing writes;
01727                        i.e., no combining with non-dirty victim entries.
01728                        TODO: fix this by changing the WBB processing loop to
01729                        not assume a circular queue organization but to just
01730                        manually rescan the queue each time.
01731                      */
01732                     if(ca->cmd == CACHE_WRITE || ca->cmd == CACHE_WRITEBACK)
01733                     {
01734                       if(cp->WBB[this_bank][index].dirty)
01735                       {
01736                         CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.WBB_combines++;)
01737                         last_chance_hit = true;
01738                         break;
01739                       }
01740                     }
01741                     else
01742                     {
01743                       CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.WBB_hits++;)
01744                       CACHE_STAT(if(!cp->WBB[this_bank][index].victim) cp->stat.WBB_victim_hits++;)
01745                       last_chance_hit = true;
01746                       break;
01747                     }
01748                   }
01749                   index = modinc(index,cp->WBB_size);
01750                 }
01751 
01752                 if(cp->PF_buffer && !last_chance_hit)
01753                 {
01754                   struct prefetch_buffer_t * p = cp->PF_buffer, * prev = NULL;
01755                   while(p)
01756                   {
01757                     if((p->addr>>cp->addr_shift) == (ca->paddr>>cp->addr_shift))
01758                     {
01759                       last_chance_hit = true;
01760                       break;
01761                     }
01762                     prev = p;
01763                     p = p->next;
01764                   }
01765 
01766                   if(p) /* hit in prefetch buffer */
01767                   {
01768                     last_chance_hit = true;
01769 
01770                     /* insert block into cache */
01771                     struct cache_line_t * evictee = cache_get_evictee_llc(cp,ca->paddr,ca->core);
01772                     int ok_to_insert = true;
01773                     if((cp->write_policy == WRITE_BACK) && evictee->valid && evictee->dirty)
01774                     {
01775                       if(WBB_available(cp,ca->paddr))
01776                       {
01777                         WBB_insert(cp,evictee);
01778                       }
01779                       else /* we'd like to insert the prefetched line into the cache, but
01780                               in order to do so, we need to writeback the evictee but
01781                               we can't get a WBB.  */
01782                       {
01783                         ok_to_insert = false;
01784                       }
01785                     }
01786 
01787                     if(ok_to_insert && cache_fillable_llc(cp,ca->paddr))
01788                     {
01789                       evictee->valid = evictee->dirty = false;
01790                       cache_fill_llc(cp,CACHE_PREFETCH,p->addr,ca->core);
01791                     }
01792                     else /* if we couldn't do the insertion for some reason (e.g., no WBB
01793                             entry for dirty evictee or now fill bandwidth, move the
01794                             block back to the MRU position in the PF-buffer and hope
01795                             for better luck next time. */
01796                     {
01797                       if(prev)
01798                       {
01799                         prev->next = p->next;
01800                         p->next = cp->PF_buffer;
01801                         cp->PF_buffer = p;
01802                       }
01803                     }
01804                   }
01805                 }
01806               }
01807 
01808               if(last_chance_hit)
01809               {
01810                 /* only invoke callback if this is an L1 cache (see earlier comment
01811                    for a regular cache hit. */
01812                 if(!ca->prev_cp && ca->op && (ca->action_id == ca->get_action_id(ca->op)))
01813                   ca->cb(ca->op);
01814 
01815                 if((cp == cp->uncore->LLC) && (ca->core))
01816                   CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.core_lookups[ca->core->current_thread->id]++;)
01817 
01818                 if(ca->cmd == CACHE_READ)
01819                   CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.load_lookups++;)
01820                 else if(ca->cmd == CACHE_PREFETCH)
01821                   CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.prefetch_lookups++;)
01822                 else if(ca->cmd == CACHE_WRITE)
01823                   CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.store_lookups++;)
01824                 else if(ca->cmd == CACHE_WRITEBACK)
01825                   CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.writeback_lookups++;)
01826 
01827                 /* fill previous level as appropriate */
01828                 if(ca->prev_cp)
01829                   fill_arrived(ca->prev_cp,ca->MSHR_bank,ca->MSHR_index);
01830               }
01831               else /* ok, we really missed */
01832               {
01833                 /* place in MSHR */
01834                 do_prefetch = true;
01836 
01837                 if(MSHR_available(cp,ca->paddr))
01838                 {
01840                   struct cache_action_t * MSHR = MSHR_allocate(cp,ca->paddr,ca->cmd);
01841                   bool MSHR_linked = MSHR->MSHR_linked;
01842                   *MSHR = *ca;
01843                   MSHR->when_enqueued = sim_cycle;
01844                   MSHR->when_started = TICK_T_MAX;
01845                   MSHR->when_returned = TICK_T_MAX;
01846                   MSHR->core = ca->core;
01847                   MSHR->MSHR_linked = MSHR_linked;
01848                   int this_bank = GET_MSHR_BANK(ca->paddr);
01849                   if(MSHR_linked)
01850                     MSHR->when_started = sim_cycle;
01851                   else
01852                   {
01853                     cp->MSHR_unprocessed_num[this_bank]++;
01854                     cache_assert(cp->MSHR_unprocessed_num[this_bank] <= cp->MSHR_size,(void)0);
01855                   }
01856                   cp->MSHR_fill_num[this_bank]++;
01857                   cache_assert(cp->MSHR_fill_num[this_bank] <= cp->MSHR_size,(void)0);
01858 
01859                   /* update miss stats when requests *leaves* the cache pipeline to avoid double-counting */
01860                   if(ca->core)
01861                   {
01862                     CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.core_lookups[ca->core->current_thread->id]++;)
01863                     CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.core_misses[ca->core->current_thread->id]++;)
01864                   }
01865 
01866                   if(ca->cmd == CACHE_READ)
01867                   {
01868                     CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.load_lookups++;)
01869                     CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.load_misses++;)
01870                   }
01871                   else if(ca->cmd == CACHE_PREFETCH)
01872                   {
01873                     CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.prefetch_lookups++;)
01874                     CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.prefetch_misses++;)
01875                     cp->MSHR_num_pf[MSHR->MSHR_bank]++;
01876                     cache_assert(cp->MSHR_num_pf[MSHR->MSHR_bank] <= cp->MSHR_size,(void)0);
01877                   }
01878                   else if(ca->cmd == CACHE_WRITE)
01879                   {
01880                     CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.store_lookups++;)
01881                     CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.store_misses++;)
01882                   }
01883                   else if(ca->cmd == CACHE_WRITEBACK)
01884                   {
01885                     CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.writeback_lookups++;)
01886                     CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.writeback_misses++;)
01887                   }
01888                 }
01889                 else
01890                   continue; /* this circumvents the "ca->cb = NULL" at the end of the loop, thereby leaving the ca in the pipe */
01891               }
01892             }
01893 
01894             cache_heap_remove(cp->pipe[bank],cp->pipe_num[bank]);
01895             cp->pipe_num[bank]--;
01896             cache_assert(cp->pipe_num[bank] >= 0,(void)0);
01897             request_dequeued = true;
01898 
01899             if(do_prefetch && request_dequeued)
01900               if(ca->PC && (ca->cmd == CACHE_READ))
01901               {
01902                 int ii;
01903                 for(ii=0;ii<cp->num_prefetchers;ii++)
01904                 {
01905                   md_paddr_t pf_addr = cp->prefetcher[ii]->lookup(ca->PC,ca->paddr);
01906 
01907                   if(pf_addr & ~(PAGE_SIZE-1)) /* don't prefetch from zeroth page */
01908                   {
01909                     int j;
01910 
01911                     /* search PFF to see if pf_addr already requested */
01912                     int already_requested = false;
01913                     int index = cp->PFF_head;;
01914                     for(j=0;j<cp->PFF_num;j++)
01915                     {
01916                       if(cp->PFF[index].addr == pf_addr)
01917                       {
01918                         already_requested = true;
01919                         break;
01920                       }
01921                       index = modinc(index,cp->PFF_size);
01922                     }
01923                     if(already_requested)
01924                       continue; /* for(i=0;...) */
01925 
01926                     /* if FIFO full, overwrite oldest */
01927                     if(cp->PFF_num == cp->PFF_size)
01928                     {
01929                       cp->PFF_head = modinc(cp->PFF_head,cp->PFF_size); //(cp->PFF_head + 1) % cp->PFF_size;
01930                       cp->PFF_num--;
01931                       cache_assert(cp->PFF_num >= 0,(void)0);
01932 
01933                     }
01934 
01935                     cp->PFF[cp->PFF_tail].PC = ca->PC;
01936                     cp->PFF[cp->PFF_tail].core = ca->core;
01937                     cp->PFF[cp->PFF_tail].addr = pf_addr;
01938                     cp->PFF_tail = modinc(cp->PFF_tail,cp->PFF_size); //(cp->PFF_tail + 1) % cp->PFF_size;
01939                     cp->PFF_num++;
01940                     cache_assert(cp->PFF_num <= cp->PFF_size,(void)0);
01941                   }
01942                 }
01943               }
01944           }
01945         }
01946         else /* !ca->cb */
01947         {
01948           cache_heap_remove(cp->pipe[bank],cp->pipe_num[bank]);
01949           cp->pipe_num[bank]--;
01950           cache_assert(cp->pipe_num[bank] >= 0,(void)0);
01951         }
01952       }
01953     }
01954   cp->check_for_pipe_work = pipe_work_found;
01955 
01956 
01957 /*Check MSHR for requests waiting to be sent to lower levels of memory*/
01958   if(cp->check_for_MSHR_work)
01959   {
01960     int bus_available = true;
01961 
01962     if(bus_available)
01963     {
01964         //if(strcmp(cp->name,"LLC")==0)
01965           //    fprintf(stdout,"\n[%lld]%s Bus to Next level available", sim_cycle, cp->name);
01966       if(cp->MSHR_cmd_order == NULL)
01967       {
01968         /* First-come First-serve processing of MSHR requests. */
01969         for(b=0;b<cp->MSHR_banks;b++)
01970         {
01971           int bank = (start_point+b) & cp->MSHR_mask;
01972           if(cp->MSHR_num[bank])
01973           {
01974             work_found = true;
01975             MSHR_work_found = true;
01976             /* find oldest not-processed entry */
01977             if(cp->MSHR_unprocessed_num[bank] > 0)
01978             {
01979               tick_t oldest_age = TICK_T_MAX;
01980               int index = -1;
01981               for(int i=0;i<cp->MSHR_size;i++)
01982               {
01983                 struct cache_action_t * MSHR = &cp->MSHR[bank][i];
01984                 if(MSHR->cb && (MSHR->when_started == TICK_T_MAX) && (MSHR->when_enqueued < oldest_age) && (!MSHR->translated_cb || MSHR->translated_cb(MSHR->op,MSHR->action_id))) /* if DL1, don't go until translated */
01985                 {
01986                   oldest_age = MSHR->when_enqueued;
01987                   index = i;
01988                 }
01989 
01990                 /* If this operation is waiting on a TLB miss, it could take awhile. Invoke the miss
01991                    callback function to reduce replays. */
01992                 if(!MSHR->miss_cb_invoked && (MSHR->translated_cb && !MSHR->translated_cb(MSHR->op,MSHR->action_id)))
01993                 {
01994                   if(MSHR->miss_cb && MSHR->op && (MSHR->action_id == MSHR->get_action_id(MSHR->op)))
01995                   {
01996                     MSHR->miss_cb_invoked = true;
01997                     MSHR->miss_cb(MSHR->op,BIG_LATENCY);
01998                   }
01999                 }
02000               }
02001 
02002               if(index != -1)
02003               {
02004                 struct cache_action_t * MSHR = &cp->MSHR[bank][index];
02005                 if(MSHR->cb)
02006                 {
02007                   if(MSHR->MSHR_linked)
02008                   {
